name: Ambassador Hotel Cork

reviews.text: I love this hotel. I have stayed at the Clarion before in Cork but the ambassador is myh favorite . The staff at reception are genuine , the rooms are massive and comfortable and the hotel has a good fell about it . Dont exect the Ritz, but for value and service its unbeatable
reviews.title: great hotel , 4th stay.. will be back

reviews.text: We stayed over as my parents' anniversary party was held there. During the lead up to and the running of the party the staff could not have been more helpful, particularly Claire, Patricia and Alan. And the bar staff on the night were very friendly and interactive.
reviews.title: Good Times at the Ambassador

reviews.text: The accommodation was really good- rooms were very large with really pretty views. I particularly loved the old-world radiators. Breakfast was lovely with plenty of choice. We had two small kids with us and everyone was very helpful with them. A good time was had by all :-)
reviews.title: Homely and traditionaly comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here with my Mum as I was taking part in a local event. It is an easy 10 minute dander to the city centre. The reception staff were very helpful and polite (and I really was a nuisance asking for directions all the time!). Ok so the interior isnt exactly 'modern comtemporary' but our room was huge, very clean and comfortable with a lovely balcony. Breakfast was good and we did eat in the restaurant which I couldnt fault. Overall I'd say this is good value for money. The staff make it excellent as they are so helpful
reviews.title: love this hotel

reviews.text: It's a beautiful hotel, restored tastefully and well maintained,staff so helpful and friendly.Lovely breakfast and no rush on checking out which was nice.Taxi five euro home at night from city center so good value.
reviews.title: Unhelpful staff

reviews.text: We spent three nights at this hotel, and it was a reasonable experience. Being hosted by a renovated military place it is quite bit stern in appearance. The interior is well decorated and furnished, though, and the location is pretty good, as you can reach downtown in 10-15 minutes on foot, maybe something more coming back, as the hotel is on a hill . . . Bedding was fine. The bathroom was also fine, but for having two different taps (and pipes), for hot and cold water, which is not covenient at all. All in all, we might come back. The reception was very good, as well.
reviews.title: A nice hotel, albeit a little stern
Wedding
reviews.text: When I was looking for a wedding venue, I couldn't find many reviews for this hotel but we went ahead and booked it as we were so impressed with the staff. Now that the wedding is over, I would like to recommend the hotel as we had an amazing time. We were incredibly well looked after, the food was great, the staff were always at hand and helpful and the hotel has a lovely old charm that made the day very relaxed and personal.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Patricia was fantastic to deal with and Chris and Alan were also always on hand to advise and help in the run-up to the wedding. While we had a large wedding, it also caters for smaller weddings and it works for both. Brilliant!!
reviews.title: At the top of a hill, but worth the effort.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights last week, and I have to say it was lovely. It's an old established hotel that seems to be working towards maintaining its reputation rather than resting on it.
reviews.title: A beautiful hotel, absolutely ideal for the New Year

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lift to the room seemed a little on the old side too, coming to a halt with quite a jolt, but it did make us laugh. It's difficult to find this type of quirky character in modern hotels. The stairs were of the grand variety and really wide.
reviews.title: Comfortable, But Very Noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stay here on the last weekend in june and were very happy with the service provided, the recepion were very helpfull and up graded us to a room with a balcony on arrival which had a lovely view of cork city. the room was a nice size but the health club wasn't much to write home about, the gym was very basic, 2 cross trainers and 2 treadmills and a few hand weights. it's a good walk to the city centre from the hotel, and up hill walk back so i'd advise using taxis.
reviews.title: We had a great view

reviews.text: Upon arrival to the Ambassador Hotel, even though we were an hour early the lovely receptionist done her best to get us in our room asap, which was absolutely gorgeous and a lot bigger than expected. It was also very clean and so comfortable. The receptionist also provided us with maps and lots of information on local amenities for children and families. The staff in the entire hotel were fantastic making a special effort to talk to my 4 year old son and giving him an activities book also. The restaurant is also lovely, staff were great and very helpful, even helpful in getting my son to eat his veggies! Will definitely be visiting again. A very enjoyable trip.
reviews.title: Loved it, recommended to family and friends

reviews.text: It was our second time in Cork and we didn't know about this hotel a little bit out of the center. But Bob Dylan was playing and everything was occupied... Many thanks to the really lovely lady at the front office for her help and friendliness. The place is perfect for tourists travelling with a car because it's not exactelly in the center but walking distance. The room was nice and clean and the stuff was very kind. Breakfast was so-so but nonetheless it's a great hotel for tourists travelling to Cork.
reviews.title: Good to know

reviews.text: I stayed for 2 nights at the Ambassador Hotel with 2 business colleagues, and we all had a good time. The rooms are huge and the staff was very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Large, nice rooms and friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only slightly negative thing I can think of, is that the hotel is located maybe 2-3 kilometers from Cork city centre, but that could also be positive, because if you have had dinner and maybe a few pints at a pub/restaurant, then it's a good idea to walk back uphill and burn some calories.....
reviews.title: We were disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel had a good website which is why we booked it for our june bank holiday break. However, the room itself was on the small side and many things were wrong with our room for example there was a round hole in the wall which divided the ensuite from the bedroom, the extractor fan in the bathroom didn't really work well (when it did turn on) and the ironing board and iron unit was no longer attached to the wall so when i opened the unit it fell out on my feet. When this was mentioned to the staff of the hotel they just said they would check it out nothing else was done.
reviews.title: Had a good time, won't be back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would also reccomend that if you are staying here do not eat or drink here there are many places in cork city that are better value for money with better quality of food. The breakfast here is pretty good they offer a breakfast buffet as well as a cooked breakfast but that was the highlight of the hotel for me. The receptionist in the hotel was extremely helpful though with finding information.
reviews.title: Nice views of Cork

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very oldy-worldy and we much prefered it to many modern, souless hotels we have stayed in. While it is a bit of a walk from the centre of town, the views you get from the higher rooms is well worth it. My only gripe is the quality of food in the restaurant, which was decidedly average. We had a set menu at dinner which was included in a package price but I think if I was to stay again I would not choose the dinner option. For a nice hotel like this they need to work on the quality of the food. The description on the menu is very nice, but the food itself is bland and dated. Other than that we thought it was a nice enough hotel and would stay again if we are ever back in Cork.
reviews.title: Excellent site.

reviews.text: 15 minutes walk to city center. The hotel is set on Military Hill. The views over the city twoards the southern suburbs are splendid. Rooms are large, spacious. Beds comfortable. The bar regrettably does not sell locally produced stout brands such as Beamish or Murphys. Both superior to Guiness in my estimation. Breakfast selection is good, plenty to satisfy all tastes.
reviews.title: Very nice old style hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Be aware Military Hill is quite steep after a long uphill walk, it might be advisable to use a taxi from the city center. Buses stop at nearby St. Lukes cross, leaving you with the last hill to walk up.
reviews.title: A breath of fresh air

description: The impressive facade of this wonderful red brick Victorian building gives any visitor a sense of the rich history of the area and a clear example of 1870’s Irish architecture at its best. It is not surprising therefore to find that The Ambassador Hotel offers quality service, professionalism and the comfort of our guests are at the forefront of our minds at all times. Experience all that Cork has to offer from the luxury of one of the City’s best loved hotels where we feel certain you will want to return again and again.
